intro: Blyxa kasaragodensis, commonly known as the Kasaragod water plant, is a species of aquatic plant native to the wetlands of Kerala, India. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant typically grows in shallow waters and has linear, grass-like leaves that are often submerged or floating. Its rhizomes are fibrous and help anchor it in the mud, while its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in spikelets. Blyxa kasaragodensis plays a role in maintaining water quality by absorbing nutrients and providing habitat for aquatic organisms.
